instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B)
I had to reball the SMC due to other issues. After reballing i tested the machine & all was good. So i took the board out & Ultrasonic cleaned it to clean flux residue etc..
After reassembling, when i turn it on the Caps Lock light is always on & cannot be turned off
And when booted into OS the keyboard & trackpad are not detected. (USB Mouse\Keyboard works)

With machine off i can reset the SMC via keyboard & power on/off with keyboard.
I cannot do a PRAM Reset. Tried a brand new trackpad cable with same issue. 
No corrosion on J4800 area & no liquid damage.
Also, i thought i might have bodged the SMC Reball so i re-reballed it being very meticulous & exact same issue.

Any advice appreciated ?
Thanks.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
Try known good trackpad board first.
New chinese flex can be crappy, so try other flex too.

If TP/KB worked before cleaning the board, then check for broken traces, or knocked off components on the MLB.
Post <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
Unfortunately i don't have a spare trackpad for it atm. But just thought i should add: on J4800 (Pin 15) "<SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL>" i am getting 1.2ohm to GND (on the trackpad with cable disconnected)
Is that a short to GND or should "<SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL>" have such a low resistance on the trackpad end ?
And "<SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL>" is only getting 0.3v when connected & 3.3v when disconnected.

Update: If i disconnect the Keyboard from the Trackpad i get 500ohm to gnd on <SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL> & when magsafe connected i get 1.5v then drops to 0.3v after power cycling...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
Here are <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> Voltages:

[B]Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>):[/B] 3.33v once power cycled
[B]Pin 2 (<SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN</SIGNAL>): [/B]2.9-3.3v Fluctuating
[B]Pin 3 (<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL>): [/B]3.3v when power connected & 0v once power cycled
[B]Pin 4 (GND):[/B] 0v
[B]Pin 5 (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>):[/B] 3.3v
[B]Pin 6 (<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_EN</SIGNAL>):[/B] 0.04v
[B]Pin 7 (<SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL>)[/B]: 3.3v
[B]Pin 8 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>):[/B] 3.3v

Also, i tried to connect a different keyboard to trackpad & same issues...
I also replaced <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> & got same results...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
""<SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN</SIGNAL>" i am getting 1.2ohm to GND (on the trackpad with cable disconnected)"
Do you mean short on the MLB, or TP board?
You've just said to get 3.3V there; pin 7 of <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.

You must get complementary logic level on pins 3 & 7; not 3.3V on both, at same time.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
Short is on Trackpad side,
The voltages i listed for <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> is with trackpad disconnected

EDIT: In other words the trackpad has a 1.2ohms to GND on Pin 15 disconnected from MLB
And the voltages for <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> i listed are measure on the MLB (without trackpad connected)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 54353"]You must get complementary logic level on pins 3 & 7; not 3.3V on both, at same time.[/QUOTE]

I will double check those voltages soon & post back. Im beginning to really confuse my self... lol

Update: Ok so i double checked & to clarify. Pin 3 gets gets 3.3v until after the MLB has power cycled & then goes 0v.
And Pin 7 gets 3.3v once MLB has power cycled.

I will order a new trackpad & go from there...
Thank You!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages are irrelevent if TP flex is disconnected.
Change TP, if you already detected short on its circuitry.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
Thanks 2informaticos, I have gone & ordered a new TP...
I found it odd that it was all working until after i ultrasonic cleaned the MLB & did not even remove the Trackpad from case.
Something must have fried it i guess... Just wanted to rule out anything else.

I will post results here once i receive it.

Cheers
:)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Keyboard\Trackpad not working.
threads.message:
The trackpad was the issue, i replaced it & all works fine now.
I guess it must have just been a coincidence for the TP to die right after i reballed SMC & then ultrasonic cleaned the logic board.
